title: Pressure density of oil in tube

content.question: Water is poured into a <math alttext="U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>U</mtext></math>-shaped tube with uniform cross-sectional area and total height <math alttext="25 centimeters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>25</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>cm</mtext></math> that is open on both ends to the atmosphere. Oil is then poured into the left side of the tube and the oil and water eventually separate and come to equilibrium, as shown. The water level on the right side is <math alttext="6 centimeters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>cm</mtext></mstyle></math> below the top of the tube and the oil level on the left side is <math alttext="2 centimeters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>cm</mtext></math> below the top of the tube. The height of the oil above the oil-water boundary on the left side is <math alttext="10 centimeters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>cm</mtext></math>. The density of the water is <math alttext="1,000 kilograms per cubic meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1,000</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>kg/m</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup></math>. The density of the oil is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="330 kilograms per cubic meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>330</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>kg​/​m</mtext><mtext>3</mtext></msup></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="600 kilograms per cubic meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>600</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>kg​/​m</mtext><mtext>3</mtext></msup></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="830 kilograms per cubic meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>830</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>kg​/​m</mtext><mtext>3</mtext></msup></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1,700 kilograms per cubic meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>1,700</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>kg/m</mtext><mtext>3</mtext></msup></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="600 kilograms per cubic meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>600</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>kg​/​m</mtext><mtext>3</mtext></msup></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
